bibliography:
Azzouni, Jody, 2004, Deflating Existential Consequence: A Case
for Nominalism, Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Balaguer, Mark, 1998, Platonism and Anti-Platonism in
Mathematics, Oxford: Oxford University Press.

–––, 2001, “A theory of mathematical correctness
and mathematical truth”, Pacific Philosophical
Quarterly, 82: 87–114.

Benacerraf, Paul, 1965, “What numbers could not be”,
Philosophical Review, 74: 47–73.

–––, 1973, “Mathematical Truth”,
Journal of Philosophy, 70(19): 661–679.

–––, 1996, “What mathematical truth could not
be, i”, in Benacerraf and His Critics, A. Morton and S.
Stich, eds., Oxford: Blackwell.

Benacerraf, Paul and Putnam, Hilary (eds.), 1983, Philosophy of
Mathematics: Selected Readings, Cambridge: Cambridge University
Press. Second edition.

Bernays, Paul, 1935, “On Platonism in Mathematics”,
Reprinted in Benacerraf and Putnam (1983).

Bigelow, John, 1988, The Reality of Numbers: A Physicalist’s

Burgess, John P., 1999, “Review of Stewart Shapiro,

–––, 2004, “Review of Jody Azzouni, Deflating

Burgess, John P. and Rosen, Gideon, 1997, A Subject with No
Object, Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Cole, Julian C., 2009, “Creativity, freedom, and authority:

Donaldson, Thomas, 2017, “The (metaphysical) foundations of

–––, 1978b, Truth and Other Enigmas,

–––, 1981, Frege: Philosophy of Language,

–––, 1991a, Frege: Philosophy of Mathematics,

–––, 1991b, The Logical Basis of Metaphysics,

Fine, Kit, 1994, “Ontological Dependence”,

Frege, Gottlob, 1953, Foundations of Arithmetic, Oxford:

Gaifman, Haim, 1975, “Ontology and Conceptual Frameworks,

Gödel, Kurt, 1944, “Russell’s Mathematical Logic”,
In Benacerraf and Putnam (1983).

–––, 1964, “What is Cantor’s Continuum
